prompt: If A + B means A is father of B, A - B means A is mother of B. P + Q - R means?
explanation: P is father of Q. Q is mother of R. P is maternal grandfather of R.

prompt: Code: × = brother, ÷ = sister, + = father, - = mother. A × B + C means?
explanation: A is brother of B. B is father of C. A is uncle of C.

prompt: If @ = husband, # = wife, $ = son, % = daughter. A @ B % C means?
explanation: A is husband of B. B has daughter C. A is father of C.

prompt: Code: + = male, - = female, × = married. If A + × B -, what is relation?
explanation: A is male, married to B who is female. Husband-Wife.

prompt: If P $ Q means P is father of Q, P # Q means P is mother of Q. X $ Y # Z, how is X related to Z?
explanation: X is father of Y. Y is mother of Z. X is maternal grandfather of Z.

prompt: Code: ↑ = parent, ↓ = child, → = sibling. A ↑ B → C means?
answers: A is parent of B who is sibling of C
explanation: A is parent of B. B is sibling of C. A is also parent of C.

prompt: If * = son, / = daughter, + = father, - = mother. A * B + C means?
explanation: A is son of B. B is father of C. A is brother of C.

prompt: Code: M = male, F = female, ^ = married to. A(M) ^ B(F), what is B to A?
explanation: A male married to B female. B is wife.

prompt: If Δ = father, ○ = mother, □ = son, ◇ = daughter. A Δ B □ C means?
explanation: A is father of B. B has son C. A is grandfather of C.

prompt: Code: + = parent of, - = sibling of, × = spouse of. P + Q - R means?
answers: P is parent of Q and Q is sibling of R
explanation: P is parent of Q. Q is sibling of R. P is also parent of R.

prompt: If @ = married, # = child of. A @ B # C means?
explanation: A is married to B. B is child of C. A is child-in-law of C.

prompt: Code: 1 = son, 2 = daughter, 3 = father, 4 = mother. A 1 B 3 C means?
explanation: A is son of B. B is father of C. A is brother of C.

prompt: If + = father's side, - = mother's side, # = sibling. A + # B means?
answers: A is paternal uncle/aunt of B's parent
explanation: Father's side sibling relationship.

prompt: Code: ★ = parent, ☆ = child, ● = sibling. P ★ Q ☆ R means?
explanation: P is parent of Q. R is child of Q. P is grandparent of R.

prompt: If × = husband, ÷ = wife, + = son, - = daughter. A ÷ B + C means?
explanation: A is wife of B. B has son C. A is mother of C.

prompt: Code: ↔ = spouse, ↕ = child. A ↔ B ↕ C ↕ D means?
explanation: A spouse of B, C is child of B, D is child of C. A is grandparent of D.

prompt: If $ = brother, % = sister, @ = father. A $ B @ C means?
explanation: A is brother of B. B is father of C. A is uncle of C.

prompt: Code: + = older, - = younger, × = sibling. A + × B - × C means?
answers: A is older sibling of B, B is younger sibling of C
All are siblings with age order A > C > B
A is eldest, C is youngest
explanation: A is older sibling of B. B is younger sibling of C. Age: A > B, C > B.

prompt: If ∧ = son of, ∨ = daughter of. A ∧ B ∨ C means?
explanation: A is son of B. B is daughter of C. A is grandchild of C.

prompt: Code: M = mother, F = father, S = son, D = daughter. A M B F C D E means?
explanation: A mother of B, B father of C, C has daughter E. E is great-granddaughter.

prompt: If ⊕ = brother, ⊖ = sister. P ⊕ Q ⊖ R means?
answers: P is brother of someone who is sister of R
explanation: P is brother of Q. Q is sister of R. P, Q, R may all be siblings.

prompt: Code: α = parent, β = child, γ = spouse. X α Y γ Z means?
answers: X is parent of Y who is married to Z
explanation: X is parent of Y. Y is spouse of Z. X is parent-in-law of Z.

prompt: If 1 = male, 0 = female, + = married. A(1) + B(0) has C(1). B is C's?
explanation: B is female, married to A, has son C. B is mother.

prompt: Code: ⇑ = father of, ⇓ = mother of. A ⇑ B ⇓ C means?
answers: A is paternal grandfather of C
A is maternal grandfather of C
explanation: A is father of B. B is mother of C. A is maternal grandfather of C.

prompt: If + = only son, - = only daughter. A + B - C means?
answers: A is father/mother of B, B is parent of C
explanation: A has only son B. B has only daughter C. A is grandfather of C.

prompt: Code: ∞ = married couple, → = children of. A ∞ B → C, D means?
answers: C and D are children of A and B
explanation: A and B are married couple. C and D are their children.

prompt: If @ = elder, # = younger, $ = sibling. A @ $ B # $ C means?
explanation: A is elder sibling of B. B is younger sibling than C. So A > B, C > B.

prompt: Code: P = paternal, M = maternal, U = uncle. A P U B means?
answers: A is paternal uncle of B
A is maternal uncle of B
explanation: P = paternal, U = uncle. A is paternal uncle of B.

prompt: If × = generation above, ÷ = generation below. A × B ÷ C means?
answers: A is grandparent of B, C is child of B
A is same generation as C
explanation: A is generation above B. C is generation below B. A, B, C are 3 generations.

prompt: Code: ♂ = male, ♀ = female, — = sibling. A(♂) — B(♀) means?
explanation: A is male sibling of B female. Brother-Sister.

prompt: If Δ = father, ∇ = mother, | = child. A Δ B | C ∇ D means?
explanation: A is father of B. C is child of B. C has mother D (D could be B's spouse).

prompt: Code: + = son of, × = daughter of, ÷ = married to. P + Q ÷ R means?
answers: P is step-son or son of Q who is married to R
explanation: P is son of Q. Q is married to R. P is child of Q and R (or step-child).

prompt: If @ = parent, # = child, $ = spouse. A @ B $ C # D means?
explanation: A is parent of B. B is spouse of C. D is child of C. A is grandparent of D.

prompt: Code: 1 = one generation above, 2 = same generation, 3 = one generation below. A 1 B 2 C 3 D means?
answers: A is grandparent generation of D
explanation: A above B, B same as C, C above D. A is 2 generations above D.

prompt: If ⊕ = married to, ⊗ = parent of. A ⊕ B ⊗ C ⊕ D means?
answers: D is son/daughter-in-law of A and B
D is child of A and B
explanation: A married to B, B parent of C, C married to D. D is child-in-law.

prompt: Code: + = father, - = mother, * = brother. P + Q * R - S means?
answers: Complex family: P is grandfather of S
explanation: P father of Q. Q brother of R. R mother of S. P is uncle's father to S.

prompt: If α = male, β = female, γ = parent. A(α) γ B(β) γ C(α) means?
answers: A is grandfather of C through B
explanation: A(male) is parent of B(female). B is parent of C(male). A is grandfather of C.

prompt: Code: → = older than, ← = younger than, ↔ = twin. A → B ↔ C means?
answers: A is older than twins B and C
explanation: A older than B. B twin of C. A is oldest.

prompt: If + = husband, - = wife, × = child. A + B × C - D means?
answers: C is married to D, A and B are C's parents
explanation: A husband of B. C is their child. C married to D. A is father-in-law of D.

prompt: Code: M = married, P = parent, S = sibling. A M B P C S D means?
answers: D is sibling of C who is child of A's spouse B
explanation: A married to B. B parent of C. C sibling of D. A is step-parent to C and D.

prompt: If ★ = son, ☆ = daughter, ● = parent. A ★ B ● C ☆ D means?
explanation: A is son of B. B is parent of C. C has daughter D. A is uncle of D.

prompt: Code: + = up one generation, - = down one generation. A + + B means?
explanation: Two generations up: A is grandparent of B.

prompt: If × = brother of, ÷ = sister of, + = father of. A × B ÷ C + D means?
explanation: A brother of B. B sister of C. C father of D. A is uncle of D.

prompt: Code: 1M = 1st gen male, 2F = 2nd gen female. 1M - 2F - 3M represents?
explanation: 1st gen male, 2nd gen female, 3rd gen male. Grandfather, Mother, Son.

prompt: If $ = spouse, % = child, & = sibling. A $ B % C & D means?
answers: D is sibling of C, child of A's spouse B
explanation: A married to B. C is child of B. D is sibling of C. D is also child.

prompt: Code: ↑ = 1 gen up, ↓ = 1 gen down, ↔ = same gen. A ↑ B ↔ C ↓ D means?
answers: A is grandparent, D is grandchild, B and C same gen
explanation: A is 1 gen above B. B same gen as C. C is 1 gen above D. A is 2 gen above D.

prompt: If + = father, - = mother, @ = spouse. P + Q @ R - S means?
answers: S is child of P's daughter-in-law
explanation: P father of Q. Q married to R. R mother of S. S is grandchild of P.

prompt: Code: A = aunt, U = uncle, N = niece/nephew. P A Q N R means?
answers: P is aunt of Q, Q has niece/nephew R
explanation: P is aunt of Q. R is niece/nephew of Q. P is great-aunt of R.

prompt: If ⊂ = belongs to (child of), ⊃ = contains (parent of). A ⊂ B ⊃ C means?
answers: A is child of B, C is child of B
explanation: A is child of B. B is parent of C. A and C are both children of B = siblings.

prompt: Code: H = husband, W = wife, S = son, D = daughter. A H B W C S D D E means?
explanation: A husband of B. C is son. D has daughter E. E is granddaughter.
